title.value: On the benefits of representation regularization in invariance-based domain generalization
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: On the benefits of representation regularization in invariance based domain generalization

extractions.description: The paper provides a theoretical analysis of the limitations of learning invariant representations in domain generalization, emphasizing the importance of controlling the smoothness of these representations. It introduces a novel regularization method using the Jacobian matrix to improve robustness in domain generalization, and tests its efficacy across various datasets and conditions.

type.justification: The paper primarily presents novel theoretical analysis to control errors in unseen test environments and formal derivations, rather than empirical experiments.
type.quote: In this paper, we reveal that merely learning the invariant representation is vulnerable to the related unseen environment. To this end, we derive a novel theoretical analysis...
